ovdesc.p: This application allows a teller to print passbook entries. This application is invoked directly after a TELLER transaction or after a TELLER.PASSBOOK.REPRINT instruction. This application can also be run from the command line.
This application will display the following information to the user:
3. The Line No the print will begin from.
4. The Number of Entries outstanding that will be printed.
5. The Current Balance shown in the Passbook.
6. The number of pages that should be printed.
The Teller can use this application to modify the Page Number, Line Number and instruct a NEW Passbook to be printed.

Once the Teller commits the data the Passbook Print Data will be collected from T24 and sent tot he Teller for printing. After ALL the pages have been sent this application will display a confirmation message to the Teller asking to confirm if the print was OK. The Teller can respond YES or NO. If YES then the Statement Entry files are updated accordingly ready for the next transaction. If NO then the entries will remain outstanding until they are actually printed. This application will re-display the initial print page to allow the Teller to re-print the passbook.

If the Passbook can not be printed at this particular time e.g. the customer does not have the passbook or the teller transaction arrived through an alternative channel then the Teller can set the PRINT.PASSBOOK field to NO and the Printing process will not be invoked.

desc.p: This indicates the current page number of the printing process. This is NOT the page number of the passbook.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.
If this application was called from TELLER.PASSBOOK.REPRINT then this field will hold the Start Date specified for the transaction Date Range.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.

If the Passbook can not be printed at this particular time e.g. the customer does not have the passbook or the teller transaction arrived through an alternative channel then the Teller can set the this field to NO and the Printing process will not be invoked.
This field is set to YES by default.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.
The user can set this to YES if they want a NEW passbook to be printed.
This field displays the Line Number of the Passbook that the print will begin from. The user may modify this if need be.
This field displays the Page Number of the Passbook that the print will begin from. The user may modify this if need be.
This should be entered in the ID field. This is the account number of the passbook to be printed.

The main account number specified in the ID may contain sub-accounts. If there are any sub-accounts then they will be displayed in this field. If the account does not have sub-accounts then this field will display the main account number only.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.
This field displays the application that called the TT.PASSBOOK.PRINT application. An example would be TELLER or TELLER.PASSBOOK.REPRINT.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.
If this application was called from TELLER.PASSBOOK.REPRINT then this field will hold the End Date specified for the transaction Date Range.
This field can not be modified by the user and is displayed for information only.
